item.title: India’s growing reliance on China poses challenge for U.S. trade strategy
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra
item.description: The United States is looking to Indian manufacturing as a way to reduce commercial ties with Chinese factories and avoid supply disruptions due to tensions.

item.title: ‘Dark’ tanker crash exposes dangers of China’s thirst for cheap oil
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Pei-Lin Wu, Júlia Ledur
item.description: Dark ships — vessels that deliberately hide their locations — delivering oil to China are posing major safety threats and alarming global shipping groups.

item.title: American family’s quest to save son held captive in Gaza ends in heartbreak
item.dc:creator: Joanna Slater, Greg Jaffe
item.description: The parents of Hersh Goldberg-Polin, a dual Israeli and American citizen, had become public faces of the ordeal of the hostages taken by Hamas. Other American families of hostages fear time is running out for their loved ones.

item.title: Protests escalate in Israel after 6 hostages’ bodies are recovered in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Niha Masih, Joanna Slater, Lior Soroka
item.description: Hersh Goldberg-Polin, an Israeli American, and five others Hamas took hostage on Oct. 7 were killed “shortly before” being found, the Israel Defense Forces said.

item.title: Mass polio vaccinations in Gaza amid limited pause in fighting, U.N. says
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Leo Sands, Niha Masih
item.description: Israel permitted a “humanitarian corridor” for mass polio vaccinations in designated areas of Gaza, after the disease was detected there for the first time in 25 years.

item.title: Far right set to win in a German state for the first time since WWII
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady, Anthony Faiola
item.description: Deemed an extremist organization by domestic intelligence in three German states, the AfD has overcome deep-seated taboos over nationalist politics in Germany.

item.title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Sammy Westfall, Helier Cheung
item.description: Israel estimates some 117 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 64 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Ukraine launches massive drone attack on Russian energy infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Russia said it downed 158 drones in what appeared to be one of the largest Ukrainian drone attacks yet. Fires broke out at energy facilities, including in Moscow.

item.title: Choice facing N.Y. judge: Does Taliban leader get war-related immunity?
item.dc:creator: Shayna Jacobs
item.description: Judge Katherine Polk Failla’s ruling could significantly truncate charges against Haji Najibullah, alleged orchestrator of a deadly attack on a military convoy.

item.title: For students from war zones, summer break was a reminder of home
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: As wars ravage many parts of the world, international students at U.S. colleges often find that they can’t return home.

item.title: As Haitians flee the capital, fears rise that the gangs will follow
item.dc:creator: Widlore Mérancourt, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Haitians worry that the violence that has beset the capital is metastasizing.

item.title: How one company’s plan to help the planet went off the rails
item.dc:creator: Chico Harlan
item.description: C-Quest Capital claimed it could improve people’s lives in Africa with cleaner cookstoves. But it promised more than it could deliver in selling carbon credits on a vast scale.

item.title: Pop star Monetochka reminds Russians of their country’s lost liberal moment
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Monetochka’s viral hit “It Was in Russia” has struck a chord among Russians who are posting it on social media with images of different times in Russia.

item.title: The quiet technocrat who steered Biden’s effort to tighten the border
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff
item.description: Blas Nuñez-Neto is the architect of Biden’s immigration strategy — strict at the border, generous lawful pathways — that is working after 3½ years.

item.title: López Obrador’s final act: A radical challenge to Mexico’s democracy
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: Diplomats say López Obrador’s judicial reforms threaten Mexico’s young democracy and the United States’ most important trade relationship.

item.title: 7 U.S. troops hurt in dramatic raid that killed numerous ISIS fighters
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton, Mustafa Salim
item.description: A military raid in western Iraq killed 15 Islamic State fighters and left seven Americans wounded, U.S. officials said. All are said to be in stable condition.

item.title: Mass polio vaccination to begin in Gaza after the deadly disease reemerges
item.dc:creator: Lena H. Sun, Hajar Harb
item.description: Polio’s reemergence poses a threat to the war-torn territory and adjacent regions. A baby, Gaza’s first polio case in 25 years, can no longer move his limbs.

item.title: Musk and Durov are facing the revenge of the regulators
item.dc:creator: Will Oremus
item.description: For years, internet moguls like Elon Musk and Pavel Durov have flown above the law as captains of free speech. Now they’re hitting turbulence.

item.title: Six people killed in Russian glide bomb attack in Kharkiv
item.dc:creator: Kostiantyn Khudov, David Stern
item.description: Russian forces used aerial guided, Soviet-era bombs weighing more than 1,000 pounds in the bombardment, according to Ukraine’s general prosecutor’s office.

item.title: Brazilian judge orders suspension of X in dispute with Elon Musk
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy, Trisha Thadani, Marina Dias
item.description: X owner Elon Musk has refused to reestablish an office in the country to respond to government requests to take down accounts that spread fake news.

item.title: Chasing the perfect abs, men flock to plastic surgery
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: Men are turning to ultra-high-definition liposuction, a plastic surgery procedure pioneered in Brazil, to sculpt six-packs and perfect abs.

item.title: Authorities race to remove tons of rotting fish from Greek port
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: The Volos chamber of commerce said the dead fish created an overwhelming stench. More than 160 tons of fish have been removed, local media reported.

item.title: Thousands cheer on defiant palm tree as Typhoon Shanshan hits Japan
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables
item.description: As the deadly storm made landfall, people were glued to a live stream, rooting for a solitary palm tree — known affectionately as “Yasshi” — to endure.

item.title: Ukraine’s gamble in Russia has yet to slow Moscow’s eastern assault
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Tetiana Burianova, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Ukraine’s advances into Russia buoyed morale but Moscow’s forces are poised to bite off new chunks of the country in the east.
